place.name: GREETHAM
place.gazetteerText: GREETHAM, a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; 3½ miles ENE of Horncastle town and r. station. Post town, Horncastle. Acres, 1, 180. Real property, £1, 990; of which £20 are in quarries. Pop., 152. Houses, 34. The property is chiefly divided between two. The land lies comparatively high, and commands extensive views. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £242. * Patron, the Bishop of Lincoln. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
